nl.esciencecenter.xenon.util

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.esciencecenter.xenon.util.Utils

  • public final class Utils
extends Object
    Utils contains various utilities for handling files, jobs, streams, and for getting OS specific information. These utilities are used inside Xenon, but may also be used by applications.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Niels Drost , Jason Maassen

    • Field Summary

      static int DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE
      The default buffer size to use for copy operations

                     String scheme)
                              throws XenonException

      • copy

        public static long copy(InputStream in,
        OutputStream out,
        int bufferSize)
                 throws IOException
        Copy all bytes from an input stream to an output stream. A temporary buffer of size bufferSize is used. If bufferSize <= 0 then the DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE will be used.

        NOTE: in and out will NOT be explicitly closed once the end of the stream is reached.

        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to read from.
        out - the OutputStream to write to.
        bufferSize - the size of the temporary buffer, or <= 0 to use the DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes copied.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the copy operation.

        NOTE: in will NOT be explicitly closed once the end of the stream is reached.

        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to read.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing all bytes that the input stream produced.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error was produced while reading the stream.

                  Charset cs)

        Returns:

      • getLocalRoot

        public static String getLocalRoot(String path)
                           throws XenonException
        Return the locally valid root element of an String representation of an absolute path. Examples of a root elements are "/" or "C:". If the provided path does not contain a locally valid root element, an exception will be thrown. For example, providing "/user/local" will return "/" on Linux or OSX, but throw an exception on Windows; providing "C:\test" will return "C:" on Windows but throw an exception on Linux or OSX.
        Parameters:
        path - The absolute path for which to determine the root element.
        Returns:
        The locally valid root element.
        Throws:
        XenonException - If the provided path is not absolute, or does not contain a locally valid root.

      • isWindowsRoot

        public static boolean isWindowsRoot(String root)
        Check if root only contains a valid Windows root element such as "C:". If root is null or empty, false will be returned. If root contains more than just a root element, false will be returned.
        Parameters:
        root - The root to check.
        Returns:
        If root only contains a valid Windows root element.

      • isLinuxRoot

        public static boolean isLinuxRoot(String root)
        Check if root only contains a valid Linux root element, which is "/". If root is null or empty, false will be returned. If root contains more than just a root element, false will be returned.
        Parameters:
        root - The root to check.
        Returns:
        If root only contains a valid Linux root element.

      • isOSXRoot

        public static boolean isOSXRoot(String root)
        Check if root contains a valid OSX root element, which is "/". If root is null or empty, false will be returned. If root contains more than just a root element, false will be returned.
        Parameters:
        root - The root to check.
        Returns:
        If root only contains a valid OSX root element.

      • isLocalRoot

        public static boolean isLocalRoot(String root)
        Check if root contains a locally valid root element, such as "C:" on Windows or "/" on Linux and OSX. If root is null or empty, false will be returned. If root contains more than just a root element, false will be returned. Note that the result of this method depends on the OS the application is running on.
        Parameters:
        root - The root to check.
        Returns:
        If root only contains a valid OSX root element.

      • getRelativePath

        public static RelativePath getRelativePath(String path,
                           String root)
                                    throws XenonException
        Provided with an absolute path and a root, this method returns a RelativePath that represents the part of path that is realtive to the root. For example, if "C:\dir\file" is provided as path and "C:" as root, a RelativePath will be returned that represents "dir\file".
        Parameters:
        path - The absolute path.
        root - The root element.
        Returns:
        A RelativePath that contains the part of path that is relative to root.
        Throws:
        XenonException - If the path does not start with root.

        Returns:
        The local file system path separator character.

      • fromLocalPath

        public static Path fromLocalPath(Files files,
                 String path)
                          throws XenonException
        Takes the String representation of a local path (for example "/bin/foo" or "C:\dir\test.txt") and converts it into a Path. path must contain an absolute path starting with a root such as "/" or "C:".
        Parameters:
        files - the files interface used to create the Path.
        path - the local path to convert.
        Returns:
        a Path representing the same location as path.
        Throws:
        XenonException - If the creation of the FileSystem failed.

      • getLocalCWD

        public static Path getLocalCWD(Files files)
                        throws XenonException
        Returns a Path that represents the current working directory. This method retrieves the current working directory using getCWD(), and converts this into a path using fromLocalPath(Files, String).
        Parameters:
        files - the files interface used to create the Path.
        Returns:
        a Path that represents the current working directory.
        Throws:
        XenonException - If an I/O error occurred
        XenonException - If the creation of the FileSystem failed.

        Returns:
        a Path that represents the home directory of the current user.

      • getLocalFileSystems

        public static FileSystem[] getLocalFileSystems(Files files)
                                        throws XenonException

        files - the files interface to use to create the FileSystems.
        Returns:
        all local FileSystems.
        Throws:
        XenonException - If the creation of the FileSystem failed.

      • copy

        public static long copy(Files files,
        InputStream in,
        Path target,
        boolean truncate)
                 throws XenonException
        Copies all bytes from an input stream to a file.
        Parameters:
        files - the files interface to use for file access.
        in - the InputStream to read from.
        target - the file to write to.
        truncate - should the file be truncated before writing data into it ?
        Returns:
        the number of bytes copied.
        Throws:
        PathAlreadyExistsException - if the target file exists but cannot be replaced because the REPLACE_EXISTING option is not specified (optional specific exception)
        DirectoryNotEmptyException - the REPLACE_EXISTING option is specified but the file cannot be replaced because it is a non-empty directory (optional specific exception) *
        InvalidCopyOptionsException - if options contains a copy option that is not supported
        XenonException - if an I/O error occurs when reading or writing

      • walkFileTree

        public static void walkFileTree(Files files,
                Path start,
                FileVisitor visitor)
                         throws XenonException
        Walks over a file tree.

        This method is equivalent to invoking walkFileTree(files, start, false, Integer.MAX_VALUE, visitor.

        Parameters:
        files - the files interface to use for file access.
        start - the path to start from.
        visitor - a FileVisitor that will be invoked for every Path encountered during the walk.
        Throws:
        XenonException - if an I/O error occurs during the walk.

      • walkFileTree

        public static void walkFileTree(Files files,
                Path start,
                boolean followLinks,
                int maxDepth,
                FileVisitor visitor)
                         throws XenonException
        Walks a file tree.

        This method walks over a file tree, starting at start and then recursively applying the following steps:

        • If the current path is a file, it is forwarded to visitor.visitFile and the result of this call will be returned.
        • If the current path is a link and followLinks is true the link is followed, walkFileTree is called on the target of the link, and the result of this call is returned.
        • If the current path is a link and followLinks is false the link is not followed. Instead the link itself is forwarded to visitor.visitFile and the result of this call is returned.
        • If the current path is a directory and the current distance from start is more than maxDepth, the directory is forwarded to visitor.visitFile and the result of this call is returned.
        • If the current path is a directory and the current distance from start is less or equal to maxDepth the path is forwarded to visitor.preVisitDirectory. The subsequent behavior then depends on the result of this call:
          • If FileVisitResult.TERMINATE is returned, the walk is terminated immediately and walkFileTree returns FileVisitResult.TERMINATE.
          • If FileVisitResult.SKIP_SUBTREE is returned, the elements in the directory will not be visited. Instead visitor.postVisitDirectory and FileVisitResult.CONTINUE is returned.
          • If FileVisitResult.SKIP_SIBLINGS is returned, the elements in the directory will not be visited and FileVisitResult.SKIP_SIBLINGS is returned immediately.
          • If FileVisitResult.CONTINUE is returned walkFileTree is called on each of the elements in the directory. If any of these calls returns FileVisitResult.SKIP_SIBLINGS the remaining elements will be skipped, visitor.postVisitDirectory will be called, and its result will be returned. If any of these calls returns FileVisitResult.TERMINATE the walk is terminated immediately and FileVisitResult.TERMINATE is returned.
        Parameters:
        files - the files interface to use for file access.
        start - the path to start from.
        followLinks - should links be followed ?
        maxDepth - the maximum distance from the start to walk to.
        visitor - a FileVisitor that will be invoked for every Path encountered during the walk.
        Throws:
        XenonException - if an I/O error occurs during the walk.

      • recursiveCopy

        public static void recursiveCopy(Files files,
                 Path source,
                 Path target,
                 CopyOption... options)
                          throws XenonException
        Recursively copies directories, files and symbolic links from source to target.
        Parameters:
        files - the files interface to use for file access.
        source - the path to copy from.
        target - the path to copy to.
        options - the options to use while copying. See CopyOption for details.
        Throws:
        InvalidCopyOptionsException - if an invalid combination of options is used.
        XenonException - if an I/O error occurs during the copying

      • resolveWithEntryPath

        public static Path resolveWithEntryPath(Files files,
                        FileSystem fileSystem,
                        String... path)
                                 throws XenonException
        Resolve a relative path with the entry path of the fileSystem and return a new Path that represents this location.
        Parameters:
        files - the files interface to use for file access.
        fileSystem - the FileSystem for which to use the entry path.
        path - the relative path to resolve.
        Returns:
        a new Path that represents the location.
        Throws:
        XenonException - if an I/O error occurs during the resolve.
